meanings.definition: The act of becoming dark or dim at the end of the day.
meanings.sent1: The dusking of the sky signaled the approaching night.
meanings.sent2: I love watching the dusking of the horizon as the sun sets.
meanings.sent3: The dusking of the room made it hard to find my socks.
meanings.sent4: The dusking of the forest created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The dusking of the cityscape painted the buildings in shades of orange and purple.

meanings.definition: To become dark or dim at the end of the day.
meanings.sent1: The room dusks slowly as the sun sets outside.
meanings.sent2: I dusking my room by closing the curtains.
meanings.sent3: The cat dusks into the shadows to hide from the dog.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day dusking in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The street lamps dusking one by one, lighting up the path home.
